featured.text: 21 a coin is, the more it is worth.

Many thousand-year-old coins often sell for no more than a few dollars because there are a lot of them around, 23 a 1913 Liberty Head Nickel may sell for over one million US dollars because there are only five in existence.
Furthermore, the demand for a particular coin will also 24 influence coin values.
Note, however, that rarity has little to do with the 22 of a coin.
Some coins may command higher prices because they are more popular with collectors.

definition.zh_def: 硬幣，通常是由金屬製成的圓形貨幣，用於交易。
definition.en_def: A coin is a small, flat, typically round piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money.
definition.example: She found a shiny coin on the ground.
